articles.title: FAU and Tel Aviv researchers receive grant to tackle Alzheimer’s-related mood disorders - News-Medical.Net
articles.description: Alzheimer's disease (AD) is the most common type of dementia affecting an estimated 6.3 million Americans age 65 and older. Without the development of medical breakthroughs to prevent, treat, slow or cure AD that number could grow to 13.8 million by 2060.

articles.author: Dana Smith
articles.title: A mutated virus, anti-vaxxers and a vulnerable population: how polio returned to the US - The Guardian US
articles.description: In July, a young man in the New York are was diagnosed with polio – how did a disease America snuffed out in the 70s rebound?
articles.content: This June, a young man from Rockland county, New York went to the emergency room. Hed been feverish for five days and was suffering from a stiff neck, pain in his back and abdomen, and constipation. … [+12768 chars]
